channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australians download COVIDSafe app more than 2 million times, social distancing in NSW partially relaxed, nation's death toll stands at 88

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Of the 70 children in NSW who have tested positive for COVID-19, none have required intensive care.
item.title: Experts say no evidence of symptoms reported in Britain found in Australian children

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: The Victorian government is expected to announce a relief package worth tens of millions of dollars for international students hit by the COVID-19 lockdown.
item.title: Struggling international students to get state government lifeline

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Melbourne could record its coldest April day in nearly 25 years and is on track to eclipse last year's rainfall level in under five months, as Victorians brace for heavy downpours and flash flooding.
item.title: Cold snap ahead as state braces for 'full gamut' of extreme weather

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: A Sydney chamber of commerce secretary emailed up to 2000 businesses directing them to refuse service to people who had not installed the app, before realising such a directive was illegal.
item.title: 'Wimped out': COVIDSafe app should be compulsory, says local chamber of commerce

item.description: Saudi Arabia and the UAE have asked the rebels to reverse the move, describing it as an escalation.
item.title: Yemeni separatists' backers disown self-rule declaration

item.dc:creator: Genevieve Rota
item.description: "Is it dishonesty or is it just artistic licence?" asks one of the experts in this week's episode of The Televisionaries.
item.title: Does it matter if TV's 'true stories' aren't totally accurate?

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: John McKechnie's tenure as CCC boss has come to an end after the state government failed to break a deadlock with a powerful Parliamentary committee over his reappointment.
item.title: McKechnie out as CCC boss as Harvey rubbishes McGowan's 'terrorist' jibe

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Members of Sydney's culinary scene are wondering who will be next to take over the iconic spot that housed the Sydney Cove Oyster Bar.
item.title: 'Hard act to follow': former PM Tony Abbott praises doomed eatery

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: The team at the Heckenberg Connections centre usually give out 45 food parcels a week, but when demand skyrocketed in light of the coronavirus crisis, they worried they wouldn't be able to help everyone.
item.title: Be Kind Sydney: new appeal plugs the gap in giving

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Defence lawyer Paul Yovich said The Continental Hotel was "shoulder-to-shoulder" on the nights Jane Rimmer and Ciara Glennon disappeared, creating an ideal environment for fibres to be transferred between patrons.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: 'Substantial' number of fibres from nightclub would have been on victims

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: A man has died following a violent incident in Perth's north on the weekend that also left a woman dead.
item.title: Husband dies after violent incident in Perth's north leaves wife dead

item.description: Tokyo 2020 president Yoshiro Mori said the Olympic Games would be "scrapped" if it could not take place in 2021.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Neither withdrawal from the WHO nor disengagement from Beijing can secure the outcomes the government has said it wants.
item.title: Pandemic response inquiry is not just about China's role

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Zoom's security protections are under scrutiny after Australian journalist Mark Di Stefano was accused of listening in on sensitive Zoom meetings.Â
item.title: Zoom facing fresh security concerns amid claims FT journo accessed rivals' meetings

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: The federal government wants you to download an app. Critics say it's a surefire way to get our personal data stolen. Proponents say it will save lives. Here's the detail.
item.title: How does the coronavirus app work?

item.description: Government employees will start returning to offices on May 4 and the city is preparing to open facilities including museums and libraries.
item.title: Hong Kong prepares to reopen: Carrie Lam

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: The scientific efforts funded by Joseph Banks produced the first European depictions of flora and fauna in Australia.
item.title: From Bankstown to Banksmeadow, the Endeavour's botanists still merit respect

item.description: Siblings of the two-year-old filly, She Will Reign and Time To Reign, have already set the bar high with wins on debut.
item.title: Rich lineage pressures Still Reigning to rule on debut

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card at Warwick Farm.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Warwick Farm on Wednesday

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The interim NRL chief executive has defended the difference in fines for Latrell Mitchell, Josh Addo-Carr and Nathan Cleary.
item.title: 'This has nothing to do with culture or race': Abdo defends difference in fines

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: NSW Transport Minister Andrew Constance said on Tuesday the trains would begin arriving in sets of 10 each month from mid-2020.
item.title: First of new intercity train fleet unveiled amid union dispute

item.description: The woman, then 23, suffered injuries to her head, neck, chest, back and arms during the premeditated attempt to murder her as she slept in August 2015.
item.title: Brisbane man jailed after stabbing wife more than 20 times

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: From indie pop to experimental, chamber and singer-songwriter music,Â our music critics review four new albums that have a multitude of tastes covered.
item.title: Alanis Morissette reminds us she's not a relic with new album

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The assessment of more than 20 construction projects, including six schools, will be accelerated in an attempt to boost the state's economy.
item.title: NSW government fast-tracks key projects to boost economy

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Vice-chancellor Michael Spence said the university needed to "increase the rigour" of savings measures to cushion a $470 million budget shortfall.
item.title: University of Sydney to review casual staff budgets as part of tighter austerity measures

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: about 100,000 COVID-19 tests performed as state warned not to cause a second wave of infections

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE updates: Australians download COVIDSafe app more than 2 million times; Victorian schools could reopen this term; nation's death toll stands at 88

item.description: A couple has gone on a Bonnie and Clyde-style crime spree across the Whitsundays, stealing cars and fuel, evading police and doing a runner on an accommodation house.
item.title: Couple goes on Whitsundays crime spree

item.description: Tokyo 2020 president Yoshiro Mori said that the Olympic Games, already postponed to 2021, would be "scrapped" if it could not take place then, according to published interview.
item.title: Japan would 'scrap' Olympics if not held next year

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The NRL has confirmed the length of the season after final negotiations with broadcasters on Tuesday afternoon.
item.title: NRL signs off on 20-round season with broadcasters

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Australian football Hall of Fame member Paul Roos has no doubt the draft age should be lifted and that a short-term imposition of a hard cap is necessary as the game gets rolling again.
item.title: Play it forward: Why Paul Roos wants footy to go back to the future

item.description: Testing for COVID-19 at the NSW Health Pathology at the Prince of Wales Hospital and Virology Laboratory.
item.title: Testing Times - NSW Health Pathology at the Prince of Wales Hospital

item.dc:creator: Supratim Adhikari
item.description: ASX-listed engineering services provider Worley has cuts jobs and shored up its balance sheet, as the global economic slump dents it project pipeline.
item.title: Worley sheds 3000 jobs as energy companies press pause on projects

item.description: Ray Wedgwood said that âroads existed simply to join up the bridgesâ.
item.title: Engineer and designer worked on Captain Cook Bridge and Anzac Bridge

item.description: In New Plymouth, the local McDonalds store had customers waiting in line at the drive-through from 3.30am, with 40 cars in a row, snaking outside the location.
item.title: With coronavirus restrictions eased, Kiwis flock to Maccas

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: After her first-ever run driving a train on the Albury line, Rebecca Blanks felt a fire. Not in her belly, but of all places, her breasts.
item.title: 'It's a savage line': V/Line driver's pain sparks quest to protect other women

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Large investors have backed NAB's $3.5 billion capital raising, despite analystÂ claims the lender is underestimatingÂ the wave of bad debts it faces.
item.title: Big investors back NAB's $3.5 billion raising

item.description: Formula One plans to start its stalled season with two races behind closed doors in Austria in July before more of the same at Britain's Silverstone circuit, insiders said
item.title: Formula One still faces a challenge with revised season plan

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Retailing conglomerate Wesfarmers will bring forward a review of struggling department store Target, opening the door to a possible sale or restructure.
item.title: 'Unsatisfactory performance': Wesfarmers flags closures in Target overhaul

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Ron Smith has been part of a previous FFA committee which didn't amount to much, but he believes this one will be different.
item.title: Former head of AIS has faith FFA's Starting XI won't be just another talkfest

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Australia will look to call China's bluff over threats of economic retaliation as research reveals flare-ups over the past 20 years have not dented trade.
item.title: Canberra to call Beijing's bluff over economic boycott threat

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: If the girl, now aged eight weeks old, does survive, police said the injury would have "life-long implications".
item.title: Qld mum allegedly inflicted 'significant' brain injury on baby daughter

item.dc:creator: John McDuling
item.description: The conglomerate's update provides clues about which type of businesses might emerge from the outbreak in a stronger position and which might not survive.Â Â
item.title: Wesfarmers offers a glimpse inside the COVID economy

item.description: The Brazilian President may face charges of obstruction of justice, coercion, corruption, and identity fraud if allegations prove true.
item.title: Top court green lights probe into crime allegations against Bolsonaro

item.description: Michel D'Hooghe says the game's administrators should consider the punishment due to the need to protect players and staff near the pitch from COVID-19.
item.title: FIFA council member wants yellow cards for spitting when seasons resume

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: While not all parents responded to a survey from principals, about 60 per cent of respondents indicated they were intending to send children back and the actual number returning is expected to be a bit higher.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Up to 60 per cent of students expected back at school tomorrow

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: An increase in supermarket shopping and home deliveries has caused a surge in kerbside waste volumes.
item.title: Lockdown's a load of rubbish: Recycling fear as household waste spikes

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: WA gold miner Calidus Resources has inked a deal with the Shire of East Pilbara for the $7 million upgrade of the council-owned Marble Bar Airport as part of a COVID-19 stimulus package.Â
item.title: WA gold miner Calidus inks $7 million airport deal with Shire of East Pilbara
